skills-sh.name: Skills.sh - Open Agent Skills Ecosystem
skills-sh.summary: Install reusable skills for AI agents via npx skills add
skills-sh.description: Skills.sh is an open ecosystem for reusable AI agent capabilities. Install with `npx skills add <owner/repo>`. Skills are stored in ~/.claude/plugins/marketplaces/. Key installed skills include: frontend-design (production-grade UI with bold aesthetics), code-review, commit-commands, pr-review-toolkit, plugin-dev, and various LSP integrations. The frontend-design skill creates distinctive interfaces avoiding generic AI aesthetics - uses bold typography, memorable colors, high-impact animations, and unexpected layouts.
skills-sh.notes: To list skills: check ~/.claude/plugins/. Frontend-design skill auto-activates for UI work. Key principles: avoid Inter/Roboto, use distinctive fonts, bold color choices, CSS animations, asymmetric layouts, textures/gradients.

yield-rewards.name: Yield Rewards Pool System
yield-rewards.summary: User deposits earn yield, distributed to shared reward pool
yield-rewards.description: Users deposit funds via Stripe or crypto payments. These funds are held and earn yield (via DeFi protocols or interest-bearing accounts). The yield generated flows into a shared rewards pool. Users can then request withdrawals/rewards from this pool. Key components: deposit tracking, yield generation, reward pool balance, withdrawal requests, fair distribution logic.
yield-rewards.notes: This is the core monetization model - users benefit from collective yield rather than individual interest.

credits.name: User Credits System
credits.summary: Credits for app usage, stored in Supabase
credits.description: Users have credits stored in Supabase `user_credits` table. Apps deduct credits when users perform actions (AI generations, etc.). Credits can be purchased or earned through referrals/rewards. Each app tracks credit usage differently.

suite-shell.name: Suite Shell (Unified App Container)
suite-shell.summary: Single container that loads all SUITE apps in iframe
suite-shell.description: suite-shell.html is the unified app container. It loads apps from the Supabase `apps` table, displays them in a grid, and when clicked, loads the app in an iframe. URL updates with ?app=slug for direct linking. Back button returns to grid. Used by suitegpt.app domain.
suite-shell.notes: suitegpt.app rewrites to suite-shell.html via vercel.json

apps-table.name: Apps Database
apps-table.summary: Supabase table storing all SUITE ecosystem apps
apps-table.description: The `apps` table in Supabase stores all apps in the ecosystem. Fields: id, name, slug, description, icon_url, app_url, category, status (pending/approved/featured), creator_name, download_count. Apps with status 'approved' or 'featured' are shown publicly.
apps-table.notes: Add new apps via Supabase dashboard or API with service role key

cross-domain-auth.name: Cross-Domain Authentication
cross-domain-auth.summary: Pass auth tokens between suitegpt.app and external app iframes
cross-domain-auth.description: When suitegpt.app opens an external app (like cadence-ai-nextjs.vercel.app) in an iframe, auth doesn't transfer automatically due to different domains. Solution: suitegpt.html's previewApp() function gets the current Supabase session and passes access_token + refresh_token as URL params (suite_token, suite_refresh). The target app checks for these params and calls supabase.auth.setSession() to establish the session.
cross-domain-auth.notes: Both apps must use the same Supabase instance for this to work

tvvin.name: TVVIN - Tokenized Real World Assets Platform
tvvin.summary: Institutional-grade tokenized RWAs (gold, silver, etc.) on regulated rails
tvvin.description: TVVIN is a platform for tokenized real-world assets, headquartered in the Channel Islands (Jersey/Guernsey). They tokenize precious metals (gold first via $VVG token, then silver, platinum, palladium) and other RWAs. Tokens are backed 1:1 by LBMA-certified assets held in secure custody. Target market is institutional and accredited investors seeking compliant, regulated exposure to RWAs on-chain. Multi-chain architecture with enterprise-grade custody. Key value props: regulatory compliance (Channel Islands jurisdiction), transparent audits, real asset backing, DeFi liquidity features (vaulting, yield).
tvvin.notes: Client relationship via Lise Wessel (CMO) - known 5+ years from DeFi marketing work. Team includes Thomas Tallis (CEO), Nikola Glumac (CTO), Nicholas Collinson (COO). Stuart previously worked with their team. Current engagement: AI integration consulting via SUITE Clients. Key tokens: $VVG (gold), $TVVIX (platform token). Whitepaper available. No existing codebase - likely greenfield AI work.

contacts.relationship: 5+ year professional relationship from DeFi marketing collaboration
